posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: Hey everybody, we’re looking to re-evaluate our choice of gyros.  Is there a consensus choice these days?  Anything new-and-coming-soon?
The CTRE Pigeon 2 is awesome. Compact form factor and CAN wiring means you can place it anywhere, it’s highly reliable, and it fits nicely with CTRE ’s other offerings software-wise.

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: There’s also the navx2 that’s a bit cheaper, however our team has had some issues with it so we plan to switch to the pigeon.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: What issues have you had with the NavX2?

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked:
for folks wondering, we’re transitioning away from the NavX platform:

the micros are physically fragile (we keep destroying the USB port)

the USB interface does not support simultaneous yaw and rate

the software seems abandoned

our most recent MXP mysteriously died (this was the last straw)

An FRC -centric COTS gyro is plan-B for us; we’d like to build our own, but that might not get done by January.

link_counts.title: navx_frc: AHRS.getRate() doesn't return degrees per second · Issue #69 · kauailabs/navxmxp · GitHub

posts.name: Rocky
posts.cooked: We use Navx2 and it held itself for last season for our MaxSwerve. I think we’ll most likely be using them, but I also heard great things about Pigeon from CTRE .

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Interesting, we haven’t really had an issue with the MXP hardware wise.

posts.name: Scott W
posts.cooked: We’ve had repeated issues with the NavX2 starting in 2023 , and continuing in 2024.  There are work-arounds for us that worked well enough, but we haven’t purchased any more, and we’re planning to use Pigeon 2’s this year.

link_counts.title: NavX2 disconnecting reconnecting intermittently (not browning out)

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Hmm, interesting… Any info from @JamesT regarding what serial numbers of NavX2 are affected?

posts.name: James Taylor
posts.cooked:
There should be no serial numbers affected. I have not been able to replicate the issue 4907 experienced in-house. I have run tests on hundreds of boards and still cannot replicate.

Regarding the software being abandoned, this is false. We rewrote the PC side of the software entirely and will run a release during the beta. The getRate() is also fixed, but I have no access to the Kauailabs GitHub, so I can’t do anything there.

I hope this helps, but note there will be no releases until the beta.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
truher:

NavX platform:

the micros are physically fragile (we keep destroying the USB port)

the USB interface does not support simultaneous yaw and rate

the software seems abandoned

our most recent MXP mysteriously died

Same here - we didn’t get good life out of many of our various NavXes hardware and software.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked:
That’s certainly good news! Granted I haven’t looked into our AdvantageKit logs very hard, but I don’t recall us having these issues. I certainly look forward to the improvements in the NavX2 library.

JamesT:

I have no access to the Kauailabs GitHub, so I can’t do anything there.

Does this mean that that the GitHub repo isn’t representative of the NavX vendor library?

One thing I personally found annoying was finding a cover for the NavX2 that covered all the pins on it that we didn’t use. But we eventually found a design for one and printed it.

Side note, I only learned today that the NavX2 library has latency compensation, this should prove useful in many ways.

posts.name: Matt Middleton
posts.cooked: Pigeon 2.0.  Rock solid.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
viggy96:

Does this mean that that the GitHub repo isn’t representative of the NavX vendor library?

Yes, but that was also true before Studica took over.

WPILib 2022 Deprecations opened 01:54PM - 23 Jul 21 UTC lhvy

WPILib 2022 Deprecations opened 01:54PM - 23 Jul 21 UTC lhvy

opened 01:54PM - 23 Jul 21 UTC lhvy

opened 01:54PM - 23 Jul 21 UTC

lhvy

`PIDSource`, `Sendable` and `SendableBase` have been deprecated in WPILib 2022. … All three are used by the latest navx_frc build. When building robot code making use of the navx library, the following errors occur:

```
> Task :compileJava
NavXGyroscope.java:156: error: cannot access PIDSource
        return -ahrs.getYaw();
                    ^
  class file for edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource not found
NavXGyroscope.java:162: error: cannot access Sendable
        return ahrs.getRoll();
                   ^
  class file for edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable not found
NavXGyroscope.java:168: error: cannot access SendableBase
        return ahrs.getPitch() - basePitch;
                   ^
  class file for edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SendableBase not found
```

Here are the relevant PRs in WPILib:

https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/pull/3210
https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/pull/3236
https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/pull/3432

NavXGyroscope.java:168: error: cannot access SendableBase

viggy96:

Side note, I only learned today that the NavX2 library has latency compensation, this should prove useful in many ways.

Kauai Labs was one of the first if not the first to do latency compensation for FRC , in 2017.

link_counts.title: ANNOUNCING:  Kauai Labs navX-MXP Upgrade, navX-Micro & SF2

posts.name: Scott W
posts.cooked:
I hate to say this but this post it representative of the support we received from Studica:

Didn’t believe us, even with all the evidence and a work-around provided

Said they couldn’t replicate it, but…

… also admitted they didn’t actually have a RoboRIO to test it on.

After we posted the work-around code we’ve been approached several times in the pits at various competitions to ask us to help implement the work-around in some other team’s code because they were having the same problem and had found our repository while doing research.

I’m personally tired of being dismissed by Studica’s support.  We won’t be using NavX products in the future.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
Programming4907:

Said they couldn’t replicate it, but…

… also admitted they didn’t actually have a RoboRIO to test it on.

Their story checks out, at least…

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: The latency compensation classes aren’t in the Kauai Labs library anymore…

posts.name: James Taylor
posts.cooked:
I want to clear up any misinformation here.

I fully believe that 4907 has experienced the issue. We have never said we did not believe them. The workaround they provided while it works for them, if it were to be added to the public vendordep, could have unintended consequences for those who do not experience problems.

I have tested hundreds of units and never experienced the disconnect issue. I want to experience it so I can fix it.

We have always had a roboRIO 1.0. However, 4907 had a roboRIO 2.0, which we did not have at the time. We donated it to a team for the FRC season as this was during the shortage, and I would rather a team be able to compete than me having two roboRIOs.

Well, it’s sad to see some teams no longer use the NavX. The Pigeon 2.0 is a great IMU, and I hope it works well and they have successful seasons.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: I might just be old fashioned but I love the adxrs450 just for the availability, price, and relative ease of use

posts.name: Christopher149
posts.cooked: An issue we ran into with the adxrs450 when we first started with swerve in 2023 is that it was quite easy to exceed the 300 degree/sec maximum that it can detect. (and then for the 2023 game we wanted to detect that the charge station was level so we needed more gyro axes anyway)
